thread.title: Southwest Ohio chef nominated for James Beard Award
thread.title_full: Southwest Ohio chef nominated for James Beard Award

author: Andy Brownfield
title: Southwest Ohio chef nominated for James Beard Award
text: Southwest Ohio chef nominated for James Beard Award Feb 16, 2017, 5:27am EST Industries & Tags Andy Brownfield Reporter Cincinnati Business Courier Share Andy Brownfield Reporter Cincinnati Business Courier Related Content Jose Salazar is chef and owner of Salazar and Mita's. Jenn Prine A Cincinnati chef and restaurateur is in the running for the prestigious James Beard Foundation Awards. The James Beard Foundation announced its 2017 semifinalists for its restaurant and chef awards on Wednesday. Chef Jose Salazar was one of 20 semifinalists for best chef in the Great Lakes region. It's his second year in a row nominated for the award. Salazar is the only chef from Ohio to be nominated. Jose Salazar is chef and owner of Salazar and Mita's. Jenn Prine Semifinalists were chosen from more than 20,000 submissions submitted since October 2016. The awards committee, which includes critics, writers and editors, whittles that down to the list of 20 semifinalists in each category. Five finalists will be chosen by a voting body of former Beard Award winners, restaurant and chef award committee members, and other regional panelists. The winner will be announced on Wednesday, March 15. Salazar was the former executive chef at the Palace at the Cincinnatian Hotel before opening Salazar in Over-the-Rhine in 2013 and Mita's in the 84.51 building in 2015. Brownfield covers retail and restaurants, technology, manufacturing and courts. Related Content
